feed.title: Seminar Women at IMPA
feed.subtitle: An online seminar series to bring researchers women working in different areas of mathematics

entry.title: Small ball probabilities for Gaussian Processes

link.title: Small ball probabilities for Gaussian Processes

entry.content: In the talk we will consider a problem of small ball probabilities for Gaussian processes, which consists in finding the asymptotics of probability that a norm of a process is less than $\epsilon$ as $\epsilon$ tends to zero. This question arises in different areas: quantization of Gaussian vectors, metric entropy, etc. We will consider what is already known in general situation and talk about more advanced results in $L_2$-norm, for which the distribution is totally defined by eigenvalues of the covariance operator.
entry.summary: In the talk we will consider a problem of small ball probabilities for Gaussian processes, which consists in finding the asymptotics of probability that a norm of a process is less than $\epsilon$ as $\epsilon$ tends to zero. This question arises in different areas: quantization of Gaussian vectors, metric entropy, etc. We will consider what is already known in general situation and talk about more advanced results in $L_2$-norm, for which the distribution is totally defined by eigenvalues of the covariance operator.
